text: The 1974 FIFA World Cup Final was the final match of the 1974 FIFA World Cup. The match was played with the teams West Germany and the Netherlands. The West Germans won the match 2–1, winning their second world cup title. ==Road to the final== Netherlands Netherlands Round West Germany West Germany Opponent Result First round Opponent Result 2–0 Match 1 1–0 0–0 Match 2 3–0 4–1 Match 3 0–1 {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" Team 3 2 1 0 6 1 +5 5 3 1 2 0 3 0 +3 4 3 0 2 1 2 5 -3 2 3 0 1 2 1 6 −5 1 == Match == ===Details=== {| style="font-size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 8 Jan Jongbloed RB 20 Wim Suurbier CB 17 Wim Rijsbergen CB 2 Arie Haan LB 12 Ruud Krol DM 6 Wim Jansen CM 13 Johan Neeskens CM 3 Willem van Hanegem RW 16 Johnny Rep LW 15 Rob Rensenbrink CF 14 Johan Cruyff (c) Substitutes: Substitutes: Substitutes: GK 18 Piet Schrijvers DF 5 Rinus Israël MF 7 Theo de Jong MF 10 René van de Kerkhof FW 9 Piet Keizer Manager: Manager: Manager: Rinus Michels Rinus Michels Rinus Michels Linesmen: Ramón Barreto (Uruguay) Alfonso González Archundia (Mexico) |} Match rules: *90 minutes *30 minutes of extra-time if necessary *Replay on 9 July if scores still level *Five substitutes named, of which two may be used ==Related pages== *FIFA World Cup ==References== Category:FIFA World Cup finals Category:20th century in Munich final
title: 1974 FIFA World Cup Final
